name: Platform Infrastructure Engineer / Node.js
description:
About company and product

  • We develop an open-source framework for building analytics applications (12K stars on GitHub)
  • The company is funded by top-tier Silicon Valley investors and is based in San-Francisco
  • International development team

Responsibilities

  • Working in a Cloud team on the development of cloud and infrastructure services (including open source)
  • Development of a PaaS infrastructure to deploy our applications on a client's side.
  • Managing cloud in cloud implementation with a lot of various infrastructure challenges.
  • Working with Application performance monitoring analytics (large-scale, real-time analytics system with a lot of challenges)

Technology stack: Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Node.js (primary language for development), Rust, different cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)

Requirements

  • Expert with k8s. Deep knowledge of its architecture and components
  • Development experience with Node.js within platform/infrastructure teams
  • Experience with AWS, GCP
  • Expert in computer science, algorithms, and data structures
  • Fluent English
  • Previous startup experience or interest in working in a small fast-moving company

Bonus points

  • Development experience with Rust, C++, or any other languages
  • Experience with contributing to or the maintenance of an open-source project
  • Experience in building analytics applications, or data platforms

We offer

  • An opportunity to join the company, developing a popular open-source product for thousands of developers worldwide at the initial stage. You have a real chance to take a key role
  • An opportunity to evangelize our product if you desired. We are ready to pay your international conferences participation
  • Remote work with flexible working hours. Further relocation to the USA is available. We commit ourselves to assist you with the O1 visa application process and provide medical insurance
  • High wage level depending on your skills and participation in the stock option program (approx. 6-8k $, but we are ready to discuss even more)
